goal.core.program

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class Message
extends ParsedObject
    A message consists of a sender, a receiver, a SentenceMood of the message, and the content.
    Author:
    Wouter de Vries
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message(DatabaseFormula content,
       SentenceMood mood,
       InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates a Message with content and mood. Sender and receiver cannot be established at compile time and are determined at runtime.
        Parameters:
        content - The content of this message.
        mood - The mood of this message.
        source - The source location in the code of this message.

      • getFreeVar

        public java.util.Set<Var> getFreeVar()
        Returns the (free) variables that occur in the content of this message.
        Returns:
        The (free) variables that occur in the content of the message.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        A message is considered to be closed if its content is closed, or if it is an interrogative (and variables are allowed in the message content).
        Returns:
        true if the content of the message does not have any free variables, or the message is an interrogative; false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean sent,
                        AgentId receiver)
        Returns a String that can be inserted in the mail box of an agent for representing that this message has been sent.

        Annotates the message content with the message mood in case the mood is either imperative or interrogative. In the former case, the content is wrapped inside "imp(...)", whereas in the latter case it is wrapped inside "int(...)".

        Parameters:
        sent - Is this a sent or received message?
        receiver - The receiving agent
        Returns:
        a String representing that the message has been sent.
